flags.title: Unpublished
flags.text: This project guide will not appear in search results but can still be viewed by anyone!

flags.title: User-Contributed Project
flags.text: This project guide is not managed by MAKE staff.

guide.introduction:
Instead of working form scratch to create a bikini- as http://blog.makezine.com/archive/2011/06... shows- why not use something like Kinect to scan a person's body in, and form clothing to fit them? Not everyone is model-thin, not every woman has the same curves.. It's high-tech tailoring!

I have no resources to work on this, but I thought I'd post the idea.
guide.introduction_rendered:
Instead of working form scratch to create a bikini- as http://blog.makezine.com/archive/2011/06... shows- why not use something like Kinect to scan a person's body in, and form clothing to fit them? Not everyone is model-thin, not every woman has the same curves.. It's high-tech tailoring!

I have no resources to work on this, but I thought I'd post the idea.

Relevant parts
  • 3D pinrter, xBox Kinect, 3D Modeling software

lines.text: The future of clothing - Custom-made, 3D printed. (Pic credit to http://meagothy-stompystomps.com/)
lines.text_raw: The future of clothing - Custom-made, 3D printed. (Pic credit to http://meagothy-stompystomps.com/)

guide.summary: Utilizing technology such as Kinect to scan a person's body into a computer, render their 3D form, and custom-fit clothing for their body type, then use a 3D printer to create said clothing.
guide.title: Custom Printed Clothing
